snippet: The Dutch company Introdans offered a program called “Heavenly,” featuring ruminations on celestial and human spirits.
abstract: Claudia La Rocco reviews performance by the Dutch company Introdans in it's American debut at the Joyce Theater. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: In its 40 years the Dutch company Introdans has amassed a polyglot body of work typical of contemporary repertory companies, including dances by the usual suspects Twyla Tharp, Nacho Duato and Jiri Kylian. Its dancers are generally sleek, handsome movers, able to traverse this particular swath of modern and ballet styles efficiently. Tuesday night's performance at the Joyce Theater was the American premiere for Introdans, though there is nonetheless something entirely familiar about the company. Even if you don't know it, you sort of know it.

headline.main: Themes From the Netherlands That Feel Familiar
